meanings.definition: To break down into simpler substances
meanings.sent1: Leaves decompose into soil over time.
meanings.sent2: Bacteria help decompose organic matter in compost piles.
meanings.sent3: The scientist's experiment showed how fast apples decompose in different conditions.
meanings.sent4: In the forest, fallen trees slowly decompose, returning nutrients to the earth.
meanings.sent5: The smell of decomposing food in the trash bin was unpleasant.

meanings.sent1: If you leave fruit out too long, it will decompose and attract flies.
meanings.sent2: The old wooden fence started to decompose after years of exposure to the elements.
meanings.sent3: The forgotten sandwich in the lunchbox began to decompose, creating a foul odor.
meanings.sent4: Neglected buildings can decompose over time, becoming eyesores in the neighborhood.
meanings.sent5: The fallen leaves decomposed into a mushy mess on the ground.

meanings.sent1: Chemicals are used to decompose the mixture into its original components.
meanings.sent2: The artist's painting seemed to decompose into individual brushstrokes upon closer inspection.
meanings.sent3: The detective tried to decompose the complex case into simpler pieces for analysis.
meanings.sent4: The music gradually decomposed into distinct notes, creating a beautiful harmony.
meanings.sent5: The team worked together to decompose the problem into manageable tasks.
